intro: Sphacele hastata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting well to dry conditions. Its presence in ecological studies highlights its role in supporting local pollinators and soil stability.
